Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw a plant that has light and water, showing it as healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant without water, showing it wilting or not growing.
The student can draw a plant without light, illustrating it as not growing well or appearing weak.
The student can use their drawings to show patterns, such as the difference between plants that have what they need (light and water) and those that do not.
The student can label their drawings to clearly identify the presence or absence of sunlight and water.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally forget or misplace a label, though they otherwise accurately depict the scenario (minor omissions).

In rare instances, the student might slightly misrepresent the severity of a plant's condition without one resource, such as drawing a well-lit plant without water as only slightly wilting (lack of precise understanding in extreme cases).
